etymologies: late 18th century (originally US): from cat + nip, variant of dialect nep, nept, from medieval Latin nepta, from Latin nepeta ‘catmint’

definitions: a plant of the mint family, with downy leaves, purple-spotted white flowers, and a pungent smell attractive to cats.

notes.text: Genus Nepeta, family Labiatae: several species, including the Eurasian N. cataria

definitions: someone or something that is very attractive or appealing to a particular person or group

examples.text: both men are aggressive self-promoters and catnip for the media
biotech stocks have become catnip to investors this year
